definition: to punish according to the law/to bring to justice
abbr. for Israel 以色列[Yi3 se4 lie4]
to use/by means of/according to/in order to/because of/at (a certain date or place)
France/French/abbr. for 法國|法国[Fa3 guo2]/Taiwan pr. [Fa4]
law/method/way/to emulate/(Buddhism) dharma/(abbr. for 法家[Fa3 jia1]) the Legalists/(physics) farad (abbr. for 法拉[fa3 la1])

sentences.english: Our military has brought justice to the enemy and honor to America. (Cheers, applause.)
sentences.chinese: 我軍已經將敵人繩之以法，給美國帶來了榮譽。

sentences.english: He said the perpetrators should be brought to justice.
sentences.chinese: 他說，那些犯了罪的人，應該被繩之以法。

sentences.english: His aim was to bring the criminal who killed his son to justice.
sentences.chinese: 他的目的就是要把殺害的他兒子的罪犯繩之以法。

sentences.english: The Pakistani government is determined to seize the criminals as soon as possible and bring them to justice.
sentences.chinese: 巴政府下決心儘快緝拿罪犯，並將其繩之以法。

sentences.english: Courts do not have time to haul in the millions of ordinary users who pilfer copyright material online.
sentences.chinese: 法院沒有時間將成千上萬的一般網絡盜版者繩之以法。

sentences.english: To demand thorough investigation by relevant departments to arrest the culprit.
sentences.chinese: 要求政府有關部門徹查此事，並將犯案者繩之以法。

sentences.english: It could take time for pro-Qaddafi people to be fully defeated and rounded up.
sentences.chinese: 徹底擊垮擁護卡扎菲的人並把他們繩之以法尚需時日。

sentences.english: They are the ones who are running. And we will catch them all and bring them to justice.
sentences.chinese: 逃竄的是他們，而我們將把他們一網打盡並繩之以法。
